intro: Lecanocnide scaberrima, commonly known as the roughleaf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and striking yellow flowers. The plant produces edible tubers that are used in traditional cuisine. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and culturally important in its native regions.
